intro: Crocus lineatus, commonly known as the spotted crocus, is a member of the Iridaceae family and is native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its distinctive, pale yellow flowers with prominent purple or brown markings. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It blooms in early spring, often before the leaves are fully developed. The bulbs of Crocus lineatus are adapted for storage and can remain dormant during unfavorable conditions.
